cs301.group8.blem
Class SearchActivity

java.lang.Object
  ListActivity
      cs301.group8.blem.SearchActivity

public class SearchActivity
extends ListActivity

SearchActivity class is one of the three tabs organized on the BlemishTabActivity main class. SearchActivity allows for the user to input search strings and query the database to find unique photos that correspond to the search. SearchActivity is very responsive, and updates as the user inputs text character by character, and utilizing the auto-fill which prompts the user suggestions based on values that already exist in the database.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Group 08

Constructor Detail

SearchActivity

public SearchActivity()
Method Detail

onCreate

public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
onCreate is called when the activity is created in the application. onCreate sets the listener for the spinner (which the user selects to determine which type of value to search by), the EditText field for search string input, and the ListView of pictures resulting from the search.

search

private void search()
search takes in input from the EditText and sends the string value of the input and the selected category from the spinner to the searcher from the database

update

private void update()
Update is called when the adapter is updated with new pictures so that the list can be refreshed to show the new results of the search.

onStart

protected void onStart()
onStart is called when the activity starts for the user. onStart creates the AppDatabase object and pulls any existing groups from the database. It fills an array of groups using the getGroups database method and sets the ListView adapter to this array

onStop

protected void onStop()

onResume

protected void onResume()

onCreateOptionsMenu

public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
onCreateOptionsMenu declares the menu options that are seen when the user selects the "Menu" button

onOptionsItemSelected

public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
onOptionsItemSelected declares the functions associated with the menu options For this version of the App, the Menu allows us to use the sound recognizer **NOTE THAT THIS DOES NOT WORK FOR THE COMPUTER EMULATOR BECAUSE THERE IS NO SOUND INPUT HARDWARE** Future development of the app will allow for more options such as emailing or archiving the result of the search
